meanings.definition: To knock someone unconscious with a blow to the head.
meanings.sent1: He coldcocked the thief with a swift punch.
meanings.sent2: The boxer coldcocked his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent3: The magician coldcocked the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The news of the sudden storm coldcocked the picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist in the movie coldcocked the viewers.

meanings.definition: To surprise or catch someone off guard.
meanings.sent1: She coldcocked her friend with a surprise birthday party.
meanings.sent2: The prankster coldcocked his roommate with a hidden camera.
meanings.sent3: The comedian coldcocked the audience with a hilarious joke.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected visitor coldcocked the host during dinner.
meanings.sent5: The plot twist in the book coldcocked the readers with suspense.
